text: The Hotel Tequendama is a historic hotel located in central Bogotá, Colombia. ==History== The hotel is a national monument in the capital of Colombia. It was inaugurated as the Hotel Tequendama Intercontinental, part of the Intercontinental Hotels chain, with a banquet on May 17, 1953. El Hotel Tequendama de aniversario - El Tiempo Between 1959 and 1962, a new wing was added that doubled the hotel's capacity. Ciudad y arquitectura moderna en Colombia - 1950-1970 In the hotel lobby, a mural depicting the deities of the Muisca religion, has been painted by Luis Alberto Acuña. Hotel Tequendama - Un mundo de fantasmas - El Tiempo The 5-star hotel forms part of the Centro Internacional Tequendama complex constructed between 1950 and 1982,Fontana & Mayorga, 2008, p.99 and is considered a national monument in Bogotá. Between 1947 and 1959, the architects Le Corbusier and Wiener-Sert participated in the design of the Tequendama central complex.Fontana & Mayorga, 2013, p.58 It hosts 537 rooms, a spa, convention centre and various other amenities. With , it is the seventy-fifth tallest building in Colombia and 33rd tallest in Bogotá. Edificios más altos de Colombia During the 1980s, Pablo Escobar celebrated festivities in the hotel.Murcia Piraquive, 2010, p.66 In January 2007, after being an InterContinental for 53 years, the hotel was rebranded to InterContinental's business-class brand as the Crowne Plaza Tequendama Bogota.https://www.hospitalitynet.org/news/4028798.html In January 2016, the hotel left the InterContinental chain completely and began operating as an independent hotel.http://www.reportur.com/colombia/2016/01/26/tequendama- finalizan-contrato-con-ihg-que-operaba-con-crown-plaza/ == Etymology == Tequendama is a word derived from the Chibcha language of the Muisca, who inhabited the Bogotá savanna in the times before the Spanish conquest. It means "he who precipitates downward".
